goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Learning how to manage our stress is the first step to providing the best support for our children. Let’s check in on you first:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Now that you’ve completed ParentText, let’s check in:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: Do you feel overwhelmed by the responsibility of being a parent? 😔
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. We will learn more about taking time for ourselves today.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. Still, it seems like parenting is overwhelming. That is okay. Parenting can be difficult. Please remember to take a pause and ask for help when you need it. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already managing the stress of parenting well before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: That is okay. Parenting can be difficult. Please remember to take a pause and ask for help when you need it. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: It’s great that you’re still doing well. Parenting can be difficult. Please remember to take a pause and ask for help when you need it. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: That is okay. Parenting can be difficult. Please remember to take a pause and ask for help when you need it. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing a progress update.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing the modules on improving your relationship with your child. Let’s see how things have changed since you started:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: How many days in the last week did you spend at least 5 minutes of one-on-one time with your child? Please type the number of days, between 0-7.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That is great to hear! 🎉 Spending time with your child is a great way to build a good relationship with them!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of spending time with your child in this goal.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. It seems like spending time with your child may still be a challenge.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already putting in the effort to spend one-on-one time with your child before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: I am sorry to hear that you were unable to spend one-on-one time with your child. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Time with your child is so important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that spending one-on-one time together has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: I am sorry to hear that you were unable to spend more time with your child. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult about spending time with your child? 🔑
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I did not have enough time.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else.

✨Think of a time each day that you could spare 5 minutes. You can even make household chores into a game to do together.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My child did not want to spend time with me.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
😔 It can hurt when your child does not want to spend one-on-one time with you.

💡 Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? In the morning? Right before bedtime?

💙 Try again so that your child can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: All my child wanted to do was watch T.V. or play with a gadget.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
📺 Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget.

❓ You could watch or play on the gadget with them.

💚Caring about their interests is a great start!

🌷 Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: My child wanted to do activities that I could not do.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
☀️ If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them.

🏁 You could describe what they are doing like a sports announcer.

💛 Praise them while they do it!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: My child chose a competitive activity. I won and then they got angry.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
⚽ Competitive games can be hard for children (and adults!) if they don’t like losing.

🏆 When they have calmed down, talk with your children about what winning well and losing well might look like.

📝 Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. 💡
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.pb: All my children wanted one-on-one time at the same time.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip:
🔴 It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time with each child when you have more than one child.

🌱 If possible, you can ask an adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend one-on-one time with your child.

⏰ Think of when it would be easier to spend one-on-one time with each child. 

💛 You can also spend one-on-one time with all of your children at once!

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion for a group of children. 💡
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.8.tip: 💛 We are sorry to hear that you have been finding it hard to spend one-on-one time with your child.
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing a progress update on the goal to improve your relationship with your child. You can find this information any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal to support your child’s development:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your goal to support your child’s development. Let’s see how things may have changed since you started this goal:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: How confident are you in your ability to support your child's development?
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That is great to hear! 😃 Supporting your child’s development will help them live a safe and healthy life.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of child development in this goal. Supporting your child’s development will help them live a safe and healthy life.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. It seems like supporting your child’s development may still be a challenge.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at supporting your child’s development before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It can be difficult to support your child’s development, and that’s okay. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Supporting your child’s development is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that you have become less confident since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It can be difficult to support your child’s development, and that’s okay. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: Are you finding it easy to support your child's development every day?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult when supporting your child’s development?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I don’t have time to interact with my child.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
It is okay to feel that way. But there are many small ways to spend time with your child!

⏰ You can interact with your child while doing something else. For example, you can ask your child to describe the colours and objects they see around them while you are walking together or in transit on a bus.

😃 Your child will appreciate the attention you are giving, even for a short while.

Here is more information about supporting child development:
{development resources 2}
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My child is not interested in spending time with me.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
😣 You may be hurt because your child does not want to spend time with you.

⏰ Sometimes, your child just needs time to engage with you. It helps to remain calm, patient, and kind while you try to connect with your child.

🌱 As children grow, they may want independence from you. That’s normal! You can support them to find friends based on their interests.

Here is more information about supporting child development
{development resources 2}
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: My child keeps getting hurt from exploring or making new friends.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
🧸 It must be hard to see your child getting injured or feeling sad often. 

🌷Children learn and grow from making mistakes. It is an important part of child development. They will be safe as long as you are aware of their activities and you can prevent anything dangerous.

⭐ Build your child’s confidence about their abilities, values, and appearance so that they are comfortable trying new things.

🎨 Encourage them to safely try out fun activities with other kids or adults. Praise them when they do it well!

💚 Let your child know that you trust them to be safe and follow the rules that you have set.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: My child likes competitive activities but gets angry when they lose or need to share the win.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
⚽ Competitive games can be hard for children (and adults!) if they don’t like losing or sharing.

🏆 When they have calmed down, talk with your child about what winning well and losing well might look like.

📝 Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. 💡
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: My child expresses negative emotions all the time.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
💙 It must be difficult when your child is expressing negative feelings, but this is common because your child is also learning to manage their emotions.

👂 Listen to your child’s emotions and acknowledge them.

💡 Ask your child how to feel better and give your child advice on what you think would work well.

🌱 While it is tempting to solve your child’s problems immediately with what you think is best, it will not help them grow.
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal to prepare your child for success in school:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your goal to prepare your child for success in school. 📖 Let’s reflect on how things have changed since you started this goal:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: How often do you involve your child in an activity to help them learn?  🎨
goal_checkin_child_data.options: Never|Hardly Ever|Sometimes|Most of the Time|Every Day
goal_checkin_child_data.positive: Most of the Time | Every Day
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That’s great to hear! 🎉 Preparing your child for success in school will help them do well!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That’s okay. 💙 You will learn more about the importance of helping your child learn in this goal.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve made progress in this goal since you started ParentText. All your effort is paying off!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal! It seems like supporting Your Child with schoolwork may still be a challenge. 💚
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at preparing Your Child for success in school before ParentText. 🎈It’s great that you’re keeping up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It can be hard to make time to help your child learn. But it is never too late to start preparing your child for success in school!! ⏰
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Helping your child prepare for success in school is important. Though you are still doing well, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText. 💛
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It can be hard to make time to help your child learn. But it is never too late to start preparing your child for success in school ⏰
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: When you involve your child, how does it go?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find hard about doing activities with Your Child to help them learn?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I didn’t have any books to read with my child.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
💡 That’s normal! Many parents don’t have books in the house. 

👀 You can also use anything that has pictures to interact with your child - magazines, newspapers, and even signs.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My child does not want to learn.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
🎨 Try to make learning activities fun! Your child will be more likely to want to learn when the activity is fun with less pressure. 

⚽ Follow your child’s interests, even if you’re just talking together. This will help them learn. 

📱 For playful, educational ideas, type {PLAY} at any time!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: I did not have the time to involve myself in my child's learning or education.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
😣 It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. 

⏰ Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes - or a little more - to help Your Child with their learning? 

⚽ Perhaps start them off with an activity and then check in with them every few minutes. 

🍚 You can also make household work into learning moments - like cooking or sorting clothes. You can do this!

Here are some more tips for supporting your child's learning
{learning resources}
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
💙 I’m sorry you’re feeling overwhelmed. 

💡 Try doing short, simple, and fun things that can fit in with your routine. 

🌈 For example, point at things like letters, numbers, colours, and objects and tell Your Child what they are. Start slowly and simply. 

🍚 If you’re busy, just involve Your Child in what you are doing.

Here are some more tips for supporting your child's learning
{learning resources}
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip: 💚 I am sorry to hear that it has been hard to do learning activities with Your Child.
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal to create structure for your child:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your goal to create structure for your child. Let’s see how things may have changed since you started this goal:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: Are you able to make sure your child follows household rules?
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That is great to hear! 💙 Helping your child follow household rules gives them a sense of safety and security needed to thrive.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about setting and keeping household rules during this goal. This will give them a sense of safety and security needed to thrive.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. It seems like it is still difficult to make sure your child is following household rules.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at helping your child obey household rules before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It can be hard to set and keep household rules.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Helping your child obey household rules is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It can be challenging to set and keep household rules.
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How did the conversation about household rules go with Your Child?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find hard about involving your child when creating household rules and routines?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: My child could not agree on one specific rule or routine.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
📖 When creating rules, it is important to think about the age of each child, so you can come up with routines that are fair for their age.

⏰ This is most important for bedtime, the time to come home, and household chores.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My child felt it was unfair that they have to follow the rule while I don’t have to follow it.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
⭐ Our children learn best from us.

✅ The more we follow the rules, the more they will follow the rules too.

💛 You can adapt the rule to make sure that it is something everyone can follow.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: I felt uncomfortable because I think an adult should create the rule, not my child.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
🌷 When we create rules together with our children, we build trust and an open relationship with them.

🔑 The rules we set will be more realistic and your child will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip: 💚 We are sorry to hear that it has been hard to set and keep household rules. You can return to this skill in the Main Menu whenever you need to. 📝
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information at any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal to manage your child’s behaviour:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your goal to manage your child’s behaviour. Let’s see how things have changed since starting this goal:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: On a scale from 0 to 10, where 0 = no problem and 10 = very challenging situation, please type a number that describes the level of challenge for this behaviour.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: It sounds like your child tends to behave well, which is great to hear! 💙
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about managing your child’s behaviour in this goal.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. 🎉 It’s normal to find managing your child’s behaviour difficult. Keep caring and supporting them while they are learning. 💙
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: It’s great that your child continues to behave well. Keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It’s normal to find it hard to help our child manage their behaviour. Keep caring and supporting them while they are learning. 💙
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: It sounds like your child tends to behave well, which is great to hear! Still, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It’s normal to find it hard to help our child manage their behaviour. Keep caring and supporting them while they are learning. 💙
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How did managing the challenging behaviour go?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find hard about managing your child’s behaviour?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I can’t redirect my child to a positive behaviour when they are misbehaving.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
🌱 Next time, try to catch the misbehaviour early on, before it sets in or gets worse.

👂 Talk to them about this behaviour when both of you feel calmer.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: I get too angry at my child and find it difficult to be positive with them when they are no longer misbehaving.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
🌱 It is normal to sometimes get angry at our children when they are misbehaving, especially when they are driving us crazy.

⏸ Next time, take a deep breath and take some space.

☀️ Later, find something small and clear that your child is doing and you wish they could do more of. Then, praise them when they do it.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: My child misbehaves all the time.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
💚 This must be very stressful for you. Please remind yourself that you are doing your best.

🌷 You may need to spend more one-on-one time with your child to have a stronger relationship with them.

⭐ Give more positive attention to them when they are behaving well - even the smallest good behaviour - and praise them for this behaviour.

🌙 Be patient. Learning to manage our behaviour takes time!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: I got very angry with my child and shouted at them.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
🌷 It is normal to sometimes get angry at our children when they are misbehaving, especially when they are driving us crazy. The important thing is how we manage that anger.

⏸ First, take a pause. You can type {PAUSE} at any time to review the Take a Pause lesson. 

💚 Be kind to yourself. You are both learning and it’s okay not to get it right all the time.

🌱 When you feel calmer, you could apologise to your child for shouting and remind them that you love them. 

🎈 Repeat the core message of what you were trying to say in a calmer way.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: I forgot to give my child a chance to do what I asked before giving the consequence.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
💚 That’s okay, this is all about learning!

💡 When you give your child a choice, you teach them decision-making skills.

✨ It does not always work, but when it does, it helps avoid giving them a consequence later!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.pb: My child got very angry with me after I gave the consequence.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip:
🌷 Sometimes, your child will react in a negative way when receiving a consequence.

✨ Walk away until they calm down.

💡 As long as the consequence is fair, it is important to follow through with it, even if they are angry.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.7.pb: Ignoring my child’s whining or tantrums is not working. They are still happening a lot.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.7.tip:
Here are 3️⃣ three tips to remember if your child’s behaviour is persisting:

1️⃣ Your child will act out negatively to get attention if they are not getting positive attention. Try to praise your child’s positive behaviour when you see it.

2️⃣ Remain consistent when ignoring behaviours. Inconsistency may confuse children and reinforce negative attention seeking behaviours. 

3️⃣Consider whether the behaviour is age appropriate.Your child may be too young for difficult tasks, like remaining quiet while you are talking to a friend. 

Remember that building a positive relationship with your child and giving your child positive attention when they are behaving well is the best way to reduce negative behaviours! If you’ve completed the Goal “Improve my Relationship with My Child” you can type REVIEW to review tips for praise and talking about your feelings together. ⭐
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.8.tip: We are sorry to hear that it has been hard to manage your child’s behaviour. You can review this skill in the Main Menu any time! 📝
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal to keep your child safe & healthy:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your goal to keep your child safe and healthy. Let’s see how things have changed since you started:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: How confident do you feel about being able to keep your child safe and healthy both online and offline?
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: Great job! Knowing how to keep your child safe and healthy is an important responsibility as a parent. In this changing world, it is not easy to do! 🌱
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. It is not easy to know how to keep your child safe and healthy, especially in this changing world. You will learn more about how to do it in this goal.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. 🎉 It seems like knowing how to keep your child safe and healthy online and offline is still a challenge.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at keeping your child safe before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It can be hard to know how to keep your child safe online and offline, especially when we are so busy ourselves. 💙
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Knowing how to keep your child safe and healthy is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It can be hard to know how to keep your child healthy and safe, especially when we are so busy ourselves. 💙
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How has talking about safety been with your child?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find hard about keeping your child safe online and offline?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: My child is always on a gadget, even when I am working or doing house chores.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
📺 It must be exhausting to always tell your child to turn off or put away the gadgets.

📝 You can set rules with your child. Tell them that they cannot be on gadgets when you are busy. Your busy time is your child’s quiet play time with toys or reading time with books.

🌷 Tell your child that sharing what they watch on T.V. or what they do on gadgets is a rule. 

👂 Be patient and kind while listening to them. Manage your anger if you find that they did something wrong online. Take a deep breath.

💛 Praise your child when they follow the rules!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My child is refusing to eat vegetables and fruits, especially when they are out of the house.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
🍅 It is common for children to refuse vegetables and fruits, especially when tastier but less healthy food options are available all around us.

🌱 You could encourage your child to eat slightly sweeter fruits and vegetables for a start, such as mangoschilds and sweet potatoes. You can gradually introduce other vegetables and fruits.

🎈 Praise you child even when they take one mouthful of vegetables or fruits!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: My child and I could not agree on which areas were unsafe.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
👂 That’s alright, even adults don’t agree on this sometimes. Listening to our children, even when we disagree, helps us understand their thinking.

⏰ Find time to talk about safe unsafe areas again.

💚 This time, really listen and show you understand their view before sharing your thoughts.

📝 Tell your child that you appreciate their opinions and you are proud of them for being honest about how they feel.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: My child told me that school or the house of someone I trust is an unsafe place. 🚩 I was shocked and did not know what to do!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
😔 It is shocking to learn that people who we trust may cause discomfort to our children.

👂 Listen to your child if they want to talk about why it seems dangerous or uncomfortable. Trust what they say - they will not say such things for no reason!

🔔Talk with someone and get support. Type {HELP} if you need more assistance.

💙 Remember to take a pause when you are stressed.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: It was hard to find safety resources because I don’t know my community so well.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
🔵 Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. Asking for help will help you keep your child safe!

🚗 Visit some of the services available, such as neighbourhood watch groups or clinics, and ask what they do.

💛 The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!

Here are some resources for you on community safety: 
{community safety}
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.pb: I am shy to talk to my young child about bodies and safe touch.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip:
💙 It is slightly uncomfortable to talk to our children about male and female body parts.

💡But it helps to keep our children safe. Your child will know that they can come to you about any questions related to the body.

💚 While it may be uncomfortable to talk about some body parts, especially private parts, your child will know how to talk about it if anything happens.

🔑 Answer any questions from your child honestly. You can do this to keep our children safe!🌷
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.8.tip: We are sorry to hear that you have found it hard to know where your child is and what they are doing. You can review this skill in the Main Menu any time! 📝
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information at any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Before we get started on your goal to have a healthy relationship with your spouse, please answer this question:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: You have completed your goal to have a healthy relationship with your spouse. It’s time to check in on your progress. We want to know:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: Do you and your spouse share caregiving and household tasks equally? ⏰
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That’s great to hear! Sharing tasks equally helps everyone feel valued.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of sharing caregiving and household tasks in this goal.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. 🎉It seems like sharing responsibilities is still a challenge.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at sharing parenting responsibilities before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: That is okay! It is normal to have challenges when trying to change the way responsibilities are shared in the household.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Sharing responsibilities is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: That is okay! It is normal to have challenges when trying to change the way responsibilities are shared in the household.
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How did sharing household tasks with your spouse go?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult about sharing tasks equally?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I didn’t know how to support my spouse.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip: 🌱 Ask them! Telling your spouse you want to help but don’t know how, shows them you care and want to be involved.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: I forgot to share the tasks equally or get involved.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
⏰ Try creating a routine. Planning when to do household tasks or ways to share caregiving can be a helpful reminder.

🔑 Once you start sharing tasks more often - it will will get easier to remember.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: I forgot to ask for help.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
🔑 It can be hard to ask for help. Sometimes we expect our spouses to know we need help even if we don’t ask them.

🌱 Once you start telling, they are more likely to help again in the future.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: I didn’t have the time to ask or give help.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
🌱 Finding time to help, and ask for help, can be hard.

⏰ Can you think of a time when you’re less busy? For example, maybe it is easier to do housework later in the evening when some of the children are asleep.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: I felt uncomfortable doing tasks I don’t normally do.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
⭐ Be kind to yourself - trying something new is often hard at first.

🌱 Give yourself time to adjust.

💡 Remember that helping your spouse with caregiving and household tasks benefits the whole family!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.pb: I asked my spouse for help but they refused.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip:
Sorry to hear that your spouse did not react positively.

🌱 Be proud of yourself for trying and be gentle with yourself.
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information at any time in the Main Menu. 📝 You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow.

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your goal to learn about family budgeting and ways to save money:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your goal to learn about family budgeting and ways to save money. Let’s see how you have changed since starting this goal:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: How confident are you that your family can plan carefully in advance about how to use money available during the month?
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That’s amazing! 🎉 Keep doing this - your family will be better for it.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about creating a family budget in this goal. Let’s get started.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! 🎉You’ve made progress in this goal since you’ve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this goal. 🎉It seems like planning your spending is still a challenge.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at planning your spending before ParentText. It’s great that you’re able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: That is okay! 💙 This takes practice and is hard to do.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Planning how you will spend your money is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: That is okay! 💙 This takes practice and is hard to do.
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How did the budget planning go?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult about planning your spending for the week?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I did not want to tell my family how much I earn.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
💰 You do not have to reveal the exact amount you earn - give an estimate.

💡 You could say, “In this household, we have this amount of money every month,” rather than, “I make this amount of money.”
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: When budgeting, we could not agree on what should fall under needs and what should fall under wants.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
👋 People’s wants and needs can be different.

🌷 Talking about them together can help you and your family to understand each other, respect your differences, and see where you can find agreement.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: I did not understand what to do.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
❓ Why don’t we go through the content again? You can review this skill in the Main Menu any time! Type {MENU} and select “Review Completed Skills”

😃 Your family members can join and help you!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: My family did not want to budget with me.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
📝 Make a budget alone first, then see if you can include family members.

🌷Remind them that budgeting can help the family save money and why this is important.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: I did not have the time to talk about budgeting with my family.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
💙 It can be hard to find time.

⏰ This week, spend just 30 minutes on this activity. You can break each step up into shorter activities and spread it across the week.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip: We are sorry to hear that it has been hard to budget with your family. You can review this skill in the Main Menu any time! 📝
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your Progress Update. You can access this information any time in the Main Menu. You will resume progress on your current goal tomorrow. 😃

survey_behave_child_data.intro: All children behave badly sometimes. Here are a list of typical behaviours that can be challenging for parents:
survey_behave_child_data.select_instructions: Please type the number that describes the most challenging behaviour for you to manage with Your Child. You can also type "0" if you do not want to answer.

survey_behave_child_data.pb.9.name: Teasing or bothering others
